*div1 type="summary"* *p*W. A. Ficklin to Austin, Jackson, La., August 17, 1828. Inquiring what advantages Austin's colony offers a physician.*/p* */div1*
*div1 type="body"*
*p**location_mentioned*Jackson La*/location_mentioned* *date_mentioned n="08-17-1828">August 17 1828*/date_mentioned**/p* *p*Dear Sir:*/p*
*p*The object of my writing you is to ascertain the prospects your *location_mentioned*colony */location_mentioned*offers-—to the young and enterprising When quite young I had the pleasure of knowing you at *location_mentioned*Potosi */location_mentioned*where my *person_mentioned*father*/person_mentioned* continues to reside,*date_mentioned n="xx-xx-1823"> five years ago*/date_mentioned* I left home for the purpose of educating myself with those means only which industry Supplied— *date_mentioned n="03-xx-1828">last March*/date_mentioned* the degree of *person_mentioned*Doctor */person_mentioned*of medicine was conferred upon me by *location_mentioned*The Transylvania school*/location_mentioned*, and am now engaged in the practice of my profession— the patronage extended to me is quite flattering to one of so utile experience as myself—*/p*
*p*But the time for accumulating a fortune in this *location_mentioned*country */location_mentioned*by the practice is past, and with it the only inducement the *location_mentioned*country */location_mentioned*ever offered to *person_mentioned*emigrants*/person_mentioned*—*/p*
*p*what is the size of *location_mentioned*San Filipe de Austin*/location_mentioned*, its distance from the *location_mentioned*gulf */location_mentioned*from the *location_mentioned*city of Mexico*/location_mentioned* and from *location_mentioned*Natchidoches */location_mentioned*the number of *person_mentioned*inhabitants */person_mentioned*in your *location_mentioned*colony*/location_mentioned*, and the density of the population— the Health and the prospect a *person_mentioned*Physician */person_mentioned*would realize. I am well aware how much I trespass upon your time—upon your kindness— in inviting your attention to Subjects interesting to myself alone— I cannot offer in palliation the kindness—your *person_mentioned*family */person_mentioned*has always extended to mine, nor the marked friendship of your late excellent *person_mentioned*mother */person_mentioned*towards myself to her admonition am I more indebeted than to any other human being for the resuscitation from that state of obscurity, into which the early pecuneary misfortunes of my *person_mentioned*family*/person_mentioned* had thrown me.—*/p*
*p*You are already apprised of the unhappy state into which political Schism has thrown our *location_mentioned*republic*/location_mentioned*— in *location_mentioned*S Carolina*/location_mentioned* open oposition is threatened to the tariff how far their threat will be carried into effect we can form no idia. their leading *person_mentioned*Politicians */person_mentioned*take a promenent stand with the opposition, verry considerable doubt exists of the relection of *person_mentioned*Mr Adams*/person_mentioned*—. I cannot but hope there is a redeeming spirit in the land which will counteract the effects of military deeds upon the *person_mentioned*deluded multitude*/person_mentioned*—*/p*
*p*The Respects of an old *person_mentioned*Schoolfellow */person_mentioned*to you *person_mentioned*Brother*/person_mentioned**/p*
*p**person_mentioned*W. A. Ficklin*/person_mentioned**/p* *p**person_mentioned*Mr. S F Austin*/person_mentioned**/p*
*p**person_mentioned*H K Schoolcraft Esqr*/person_mentioned* A *person_mentioned*Scientific gentleman*/person_mentioned* who for a considerable time during your absence resided with your *person_mentioned*father */person_mentioned*has received a high appointment by government in a *location_mentioned*Southern Exploring expedition*/location_mentioned**/p*
*/div1*
